block.p: Dr. Jill Beth Ostrager, an internist, and Dr. Bruce Charles Cohen, a radiologist, are to be married this afternoon in Manhasset, N.Y. Rabbi Lester Polonsky will officiate at Temple Judea of Manhasset.

Dr. Ostrager, 32, will keep her name professionally. She practices at Primary Care Associates and is a clinical instructor in the department of medicine at the Mount Sinai School of Medicine, both in Manhattan. She graduated from Stanford University and Albany Medical College. She is the daughter of Adele and David Ostrager of Brooklyn. Her father is a senior accountant investigator in the financial crimes division of the Manhattan District Attorney's office. Her mother retired as a secretary at William E. Grady Technical-Vocational High School in Brooklyn.

Dr. Jill Beth Ostrager, an internist, and Dr. Bruce Charles Cohen, a radiologist, are to be married this afternoon in Manhasset, N.Y. Rabbi Lester Polonsky will officiate at Temple Judea of Manhasset.

Dr. Ostrager, 32, will keep her name professionally. She practices at Primary Care Associates and is a clinical instructor in the department of medicine at the Mount Sinai School of Medicine, both in Manhattan. She graduated from Stanford University and Albany Medical College. She is the daughter of Adele and David Ostrager of Brooklyn. Her father is a senior accountant investigator in the financial crimes division of the Manhattan District Attorney's office. Her mother retired as a secretary at William E. Grady Technical-Vocational High School in Brooklyn.

Dr. Cohen, 36, practices at the Montefiore Medical Center and is an assistant professor of radiology at the Albert Einstein College of Medicine, both in the Bronx. He graduated from Johns Hopkins University and received a medical degree and a master's degree in biophysics from the State University at Buffalo. He is a son of Gloria and Raphael Cohen of West Palm Beach, Fla. His mother is a circulation sales representative for The Sun-Sentinel newspaper in Deerfield Park, Fla. His father retired as the oral communications skills laboratory teacher at Public School 183 in Rockaway Beach, Queens, and also as the principal of the religious education program at Temple Judea.
